data.name: Hochbrücke (high bridge)
data.abstract: The Hochbrücke over the Limmat was built in 1926 in the style of a Roman aqueduct.
data.description: At the request of Walter Boveri, founder of Brown Boveri & Cie, this steel-concrete structure was overlaid with Ticino gneiss, which significantly increased the cost but which has protected the bridge until today. The Hochbrücke is some 26 metres above the water level of the Limmat and the large arch has a span of 72 metres. The eastern end of the bridge affords a beautiful view over the tiered aspect of Baden’s medieval Old Town. Before the construction of the Hochbrücke, traffic to and from Wettingen and Zurich had to use the steep Haldenstrasse over the covered wooden bridge.

data.name: Historical Points
data.abstract: Where spirituality and beauty unite. St.Gallen has a very special landmark: its sublime cathedral. It forms, with the world famous Abbey Library, a historic ensemble that is unrivalled, and which was declared UNESCO World Heritage in 1983. The famous Abbey Library sports the most beautiful secular Rococo interior in Switzerland. Dubbed a “pharmacy for the soul”, it is home to 170.000 books as well as 2.000 priceless medieval manuscripts.
data.description:
HIGHLIGHTS IN ST. GALLEN
Religious sites [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/interests/excursions/religious-sites.html?start=26]
Overnight at a monestary [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/accommodation/other_types/extraordinary-hotels-in-switzerland/overnights-in-a-monastery.html]
Christmas Markets [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/event_calendar/event_results.cfm?f2=stxmas] 
HISTORY OF ST. GALLEN
The city of St.Gallen was founded by the Irish monk Gallus in 612. In search of a suitable place for his hermit's cell, he stumbled and fell into a bush of thorns somewhere in a wild, narrow high-lying valley of what is now St.Gallen. He took that and his close encounter with a bear to be signs sent to him by God and decided to stay. One hundred years later, the very place where Gallus set up his hermitage became the site of an abbey which was to become the "writing room of Europe" in the Middle Ages and one of the most important cultural centres of the Occident. The town that gradually grew up around that abbey is St.Gallen. 

St.Gallen's history, the splendour of its abbey and the monuments that testify to civic pride and a prosperous economy in the Middle Ages, are evident at every turn in St.Gallen. The abbey district with its magnificent baroque cathedral forms a unique historical ensemble, which was designated a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in the year 1983. Visitors to the abbey's rococo library can admire 170,000 medieval books and 2000 original manuscripts in changing temporary exhibitions. 

TEXTILES IN ST. GALLEN
The production of textiles played a significant role in St.Gallen as early as the Middle Ages. For centuries, cloth from St.Gallen was a lucrative export article, appreciated throughout Europe for its quality. During the industrial revolution in the 19th century, it was embroidery and fine lace that accounted for St.Gallen's fame. The textile museum provides a fascinating account of the town's "textile" history.

ST. GALLEN AND VICINITY 
The city’s central location in the Lake Constance region makes it an ideal base for a host of excursions to Lake Constance or to the mountains of the Appenzellerland for example to the mount Säntis (2,501 m/8,205 f) the most famous mountain in Eastern Switzerland. 

The rural St.Gallen area is as well a marvellous hiking and biking region, with lake and mountain panoramas always in view.

In 2012 St.Gallen will celebrate its 1400 year anniversary with various events.
THE INTERNATIONAL MUSEUM OF THE REFORMATION
This museum is a must-see for religious visitors that come to Geneva, Switzerland. It begins with an emphasis on the Bible and includes some of the oldest French and English Bibles. Unique objects, manuscripts, rare books, engravings and paintings illustrate the close ties of Geneva and John Calvin to the Reformation.
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/interests/excursions/religious-sites/musee-international-de-la-reforme-international-museum-of-the-reformation-genf.html]
OVERNIGHT IN A MONASTERY
Experience how it is to live in a monastery and overnight in one of the various abbeys and monasteries in Switzerland that offer simple accommodation. Some even offer their own mountain hut refuge to rent, like the convent of St.John in Muestair
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/accommodation/other_types/extraordinary-hotels-in-switzerland/overnights-in-a-monastery.html?all]
THE PILGRIMAGE WAY OF ST. JAMES ALONG SWITZERLAND’S BREATHTAKING MOUNTAIN SCENERY.
Walk or cycle on St. James' footsteps, following his ways through the breathtaking mountain scenery of Switzerland to Santiago de Compostela. Take your time to visit some of the traditional pilgrims' stations.
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/home/summervacations/excursion-summer/summer-mountain-tips/the-way-itself-is-the-goal.html]
CHRISTMAS MARKETS.
The Christmas season will soon be here again.. as well as the traditional Christmas markets in Switzerland. Montreux is home to the largest one, Bremgarten (Aargau) to one of the biggest ones in terms of vendors. The highest one can be visited on Mt. Pilatus. Others can be found in Huttwil (Bern), Zürich or Basel. 
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/service-updates/events.html?strubrik=2161]

data.name: Pfannenstiel Tower
data.abstract: The Pfannenstiel Tower was renovated in the summer of 2013 and has a turbulent history: The steel lattice tower was originally built on Bachtel mountain in 1893. Since it was not suitable as an aerial mast, it was reconstructed on the Pfannenstiel in 1992.
data.description: In 1979 the Zurich Governing Council added the 31-meter tower to the list of structures under landmark protection. At its new location on the Pfannenstiel it offers stunning views from the top. An information sign with the names and outlines of the mountains visible from the tower was installed on the viewing platform of the Pfannestiel Tower.

data.name: On the trail of the ibex
data.abstract: Under the name of the "Capricorn Centre", an innovation and innovation centre for nature and culture, language, research, hunting and regional development is being set up on the Schamserberg. The ibex (sign of Capricorn) is the symbolic focus.
data.description:
A small permanent exhibition about the ibex, going on hunting trips and enjoying the culinary specialities of the region are all part of the experience on the Schamserberg.

There were ibex living in what is now Switzerland as much as 18,000 years ago. Following the introduction of hunting with firearms, the proud beast was more and more persecuted and 200 years ago there were no ibex left in the Swiss Alps.

100 years later, the ibex began to return to Switzerland – young animals were smuggled to Switzerland from the Gran Paradiso National Park in Italy. At first they only lived in zoos, but today there are 15,000 animals living in the wild in Switzerland. Since 1977 controlled hunting of the species has been allowed again. 

The reintroduction of the ibex was Switzerland's first animal conservation project. 

The Center da Capricorns is also a research centre. The IUNR (Institute of Natural Resource Sciences) at the ZHAW (Zurich University of Applied Sciences) has set up a branch office at the Center da Capricorns in the form of its unit for Tourism and Sustainable Development. The unit deals with tourism issues and in general with sustainable development in rural areas. It was also the initiator and developer of the Beverin Nature Park.
Free admission to the permanent exhibition. Guided walks to the ibex colony in Safien-Rheinwald (Schams).

data.name: Scooter fun
data.abstract: Speedy scooter descent to Filzbach – time and again with views over the delightfully picturesque Lake Walen.
data.description:
Reaching the Habergschwänd departure point for the airy descent is a piece of cake with the chairlift, with scooters and protective headgear conveniently for rent at the chairlift valley station. And on touching base following the 7.5-long-kilometer descent on the sealed mountain road, the average participant has just one thing in mind…. starting over and doing it again! 

How to get there:
A3 (Zürich-Chur) and A13 (Lake Constance-Sargans-Chur). Autobahn exit "Murg/Kerenzerberg". The follow the main road to Filzbach.

data.name: Historical Points Basel
data.abstract: Basel – Switzerland’s capital of art and culture Nestling in the heart of Europe in the three countries corner where Switzerland, Germany and France meet, Basel is a pocket-sized metropolis that combines proverbial Swiss quality with a multicultural population. More than 40 museums with their long-established collections and spectacular special exhibitions are the foundation of Basel's reputation as a city of art and museums.
data.description:
HIGHLIGHTS IN BASEL
Religious sites [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/interests/excursions/religious-sites.html?start=26]
Overnight at a monestary [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/accommodation/other_types/extraordinary-hotels-in-switzerland/overnights-in-a-monastery.html]
Christmas Markets [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/event_calendar/event_results.cfm?f2=stxmas] 
FROM THE CHURCH COUNCIL TO REFORMATION
But along with those gems of modern architecture you will find buildings dating back to the Middle Age like the Cathedral. With its red sandstone walls, multicoloured roof tiles and twin towers, it is a dominant feature of the city. The crypt, the choir, the tomb of Erasmus of Rotterdam, the Galluspforte and the two cloisters are a testimony to the eventful history of its construction over a period of several centuries. Christianity became established in the Basel region in the late Roman era. Documents exist which mention bishops from Augusta Raurica, a Roman civil town located roughly 10 km upstream. From the 8th century onwards the names of all bishops who resided in Basel are known. In 1529, Basel fully converted to the Protestant faith. The bishop and cathedral chapter left the city, but the Cathedral remained one of the most popular sights. Today, mediaeval churches are found side by side with modern buildings designed by major international architects, such as Herzog & de Meuron or Renzo Piano. 

THE CRADLE OF THE JEWISH STATE 
The First Zionist Congress was the inaugural congress of the Zionist Organization held in Basel in 1897. It was convened and chaired by Theodor Herzl, the founder of the modern Zionism movement, as a symbolic parliament for the small minority of Jewry in agreement with the implementation of Zionist goals. The congress formulated a Zionist platform, known as the Basel programme, and founded the Zionist Organization. Still today, lots of people come to have a look at the balcony of the Grand Hotel Les Trois Rois, where Herzl stayed during the congress. And between the Marktplatz and the synagogue visitors of the city can find many traces of Jewish life from the Middle Ages to the present day.
THE INTERNATIONAL MUSEUM OF THE REFORMATION
This museum is a must-see for religious visitors that come to Geneva, Switzerland. It begins with an emphasis on the Bible and includes some of the oldest French and English Bibles. Unique objects, manuscripts, rare books, engravings and paintings illustrate the close ties of Geneva and John Calvin to the Reformation.
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/interests/excursions/religious-sites/musee-international-de-la-reforme-international-museum-of-the-reformation-genf.html]
OVERNIGHT IN A MONASTERY
Experience how it is to live in a monastery and overnight in one of the various abbeys and monasteries in Switzerland that offer simple accommodation. Some even offer their own mountain hut refuge to rent, like the convent of St.John in Muestair
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/accommodation/other_types/extraordinary-hotels-in-switzerland/overnights-in-a-monastery.html?all]
THE PILGRIMAGE WAY OF ST. JAMES ALONG SWITZERLAND’S BREATHTAKING MOUNTAIN SCENERY.
Walk or cycle on St. James' footsteps, following his ways through the breathtaking mountain scenery of Switzerland to Santiago de Compostela. Take your time to visit some of the traditional pilgrims' stations.
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/home/summervacations/excursion-summer/summer-mountain-tips/the-way-itself-is-the-goal.html]
CHRISTMAS MARKETS.
The Christmas season will soon be here again.. as well as the traditional Christmas markets in Switzerland. Montreux is home to the largest one, Bremgarten (Aargau) to one of the biggest ones in terms of vendors. The highest one can be visited on Mt. Pilatus. Others can be found in Huttwil (Bern), Zürich or Basel. 
more info [http://www.myswitzerland.com/en/service-updates/events.html?strubrik=2161]

data.name: Bäumli
data.abstract: The Bäumli is Winterthur's most popular vantage point. On the terrace above the hillside vineyards of the Goldenberg you can enjoy the view over the entire city and a fantastic view of the Alps.
data.description: It’s only a few steps from the lookout point to the Restaurant Goldberg. On the inviting terrace enjoy an excellent meal made with market-fresh, seasonal ingredients accompanied by fine wines. Winterthur is also the perfect base for trips to the Zurich Oberland, Zurich Weinland and Zurich Unterland regions. Popular excursion destinations are the Hörnli in the Zurich Oberland and the Neeracherried nature reserve in the Zurich Unterland.

data.name: Konnex Building Baden
data.description: The ABB Engineering-Gebäude Konnex, is a building with a glass facade, which was built in 1995 in accordance with the plans of Theo Hotz, Zürich.

data.name: Bench tour in the Oberland
data.description: There are many lovely benches in the Zurich Oberland where walkers can rest their tired feet. Erwin Fässler knows an entertaining story about every bench. His bench tour leads from a farm in Bauma to the Juckerfarm in Pfäffikon and continues to the Sternenberg dairy.

data.name: Sikypark - the Swiss animal rescue park
data.abstract: Sikypark rescues native and exotic animals such as tigers, wolves, lynx or parrots and gives them a home. Experience a day out for the whole family with playtimes with animals, picnic tables, a restaurant and the Siky Express.
data.description:
The Sikypark in Crémines (BE) is home to more than 850 animals from over 120 species on an area of 50,000 square metres. The zoo team uses daily play and activity sessions to inform visitors about the capabilities of the various animals and birds that live in the zoo. In the summer the birds of prey are allowed to fly freely in the park.

There is so much for both young and old to discover in the animal rescue park. An exploration trail instructs as it guides explorers through the wild animal section. Sikypark is also the only Swiss zoo boasting a white lion and white tigers. The walk-in aviary for large parrots is the largest of its kind in Switzerland.

How to find us:
Sikypark is only an hour’s drive from Basel, Bern, Lucerne and Zurich on the Moutier-Balsthal road. Trains on the Moutier-Solothurn line stop at the "Crémines Zoo” station.

 * The animal rescue park is open all year round: opening hours in winter are from 9.00 am to 5.00 pm and in the summer from 9.00 am to 6.00 pm.
 * The admission price includes the daily programme with informative talks on animals, flight training (summer week-ends), flight demonstrations (summer), a “tiger school” among the white tigers and feeding time for the predators.
 * A playground, Luna Park, pony rides and a trip through the park on the Siky Express ensure that there is plenty of variety for even the smallest visitors.
 * A selection of food and refreshments are available in the self-service restaurant which is open every day.
 * Admission prices and further information can be found at sikypark.ch.

data.name: Koster Sheep's Milk Cheese Dairy
data.description: The sheep's milk cheese dairy is rightly treated as an insider's recommendation: sheep's milk cheese with its distinctive creamy flavour is produced in the Zurich Oberland at 900 metres a.s.l. on the family-owned cheese dairy of Franz Koster. Its other products include sheep's milk yoghourt, feta cheese, fresh cheese and milk.

data.name: Gentle trails that will inspire you: A leisurely hike is good for the soul
data.abstract: Around Rheinfelden there are many inspiring themed trails to explore.
data.description: Ideal for those who enjoy a more leisurely pace. The rolling hills of the Fricktal region can be explored without having to undertake any strenuous climbs. Hiking can be just as enjoyable without high mountain peaks. Most of the trails begin in the heart of the romantic Old Town. Explore the river landscape along the Rheinufer-Rundweg trail, discover the art of beer brewing on the Hopfen & Malz trail or set off in search of precious white gold ‒ otherwise known as salt. The well marked routes offer pure enjoyment every step of the way. Rheinfelden is within easy reach of Zurich and Basel.

data.name: Max Chocolatier
data.abstract: “Who thought there would be a healthy chocolate heaven?”
data.description:
Once upon a time, there was a young boy whose mouth often bore telltale chocolate smudges. On 27 September 2009, the boy’s father made a dream come true. That day saw the opening of Max Chocolatier in Lucerne. Mixing a passion for chocolate with a pantry full of natural ingredients, a team of chocolate-making magicians and a file of secret recipes, Max Chocolatier set about turning sweet treats into heart-melting experiences. 

Celebrating a birthday, a great team, or simply your love of chocolate? Why not do it in chocolate paradise? We’d be happy to open the gates of our chocolate heavens in Lucerne or Zurich to welcome our guests. You’ll discover the secrets of Max Chocolatier during a 45-minute tasting. In Lucerne you can then put your knowledge into practice with your own 45-minute creative session, making chocolate with our experts. And a glance through the atelier window at the mountains and lake will leave you in no doubt about the Swissness of your craftsmanship!

data.name: Lake Walensee boat trip – experience the Swiss fjord
data.abstract: Far away from the hustle and bustle of the big city, but still within easy reach, the Walensee boat trip entices with an unforgettable experience in a dramatic setting. Let yourself be enchanted by the imposing Churfirsten, the wildly romantic nature and the crystal-clear water. Whether you want to relax, enjoy or celebrate – the Walensee ship makes everything possible.
data.description:
During the season, the Walensee boat trip offers various round trips in the best setting. Popular highlights are a visit to the car-free wine village of Quinten or a detour to the Seerenbach Falls, which plunge almost 600 meters into the depths and are among the highest waterfalls in Europe.

The event ships are the perfect choice for all those who want to combine enjoyment and leisure in an extraordinary setting. Whether it's a romantic dinner or a harmonious themed trip – the varied offer ensures that nothing is left to be desired.

For special occasions, private boat rental is at your disposal. Celebrate birthdays, family celebrations or weddings in an exclusive ambience. Companies can also use the Walensee ships for seminars, business aperitifs or Christmas dinners and thus enjoy their event with the best view.

The region is perfectly developed in terms of transport and can be reached from Zurich in just one hour. The crystal-clear lake is one of the deepest bodies of water in Switzerland. The landscape is strongly reminiscent of a Norwegian fjord, but at the same time impresses with a mild, almost Mediterranean, climate.

Experience the dramatic landscape from the best angle and let yourself be carried away on the Walensee ship!

data.name: Promenade Lift and Limmat Footbridge
data.abstract: Since 2007, at the spot where a cable ferry used to run, this bridge and lift have provided a direct connection from the Bahnhofplatz Baden to the Limmat Promenade and on to Ennetbaden.
data.description: The sensitive design and clever placement provide for an impressive lift ride through the massive treetops of the Oelrain forest down to the river area where the water can be seen going under the bridge. There is good reason why this access way has become the prettiest and most popular promenade for the locals of Baden and Ennetbaden. Visitors to the area also appreciate this scenic short-cut over the river. Red-brown in colour – varying in shade depending on the light – this steel artifact complements its surroundings. Architects: Leuppi & Schafroth Architekten AG, Zurich (2007)

data.name: A cable car experience for the young – and for the young at heart!
data.abstract: Above Fanas in Prättigau, the small aerial cableway opens onto a hiking area above the fog that gets more than its fair share of sunshine, particularly during the winter. Whether you opt to savour a platter of cold cuts on the sun terrace or embark on a winter hike, the little cable car is worth a trip in itself.
data.description:
Starting at Landquart, the region of Prättigau snakes its way in a north-easterly direction into the heart of Graubünden. From the picturesque mountain village of Fanas, one of the few small aerial cableways in Graubünden opens onto a magnificent hiking area. The area is usually above the fog, even in winter, and receives above-average levels of sunshine.

The upper station of the aerial cableway lies at 1,700 metres above sea level and is the ideal starting point for various winter hikes or walks. Connoisseurs will love sitting on the sun terrace of the Sassauna mountain restaurant and tucking into a delicious platter of cold cuts as their gaze wanders over the panorama below. Here, everything is a part of the overall experience: the train, the journey and the view.
With a journey time of one hour from St. Gallen or Zurich, the charming aerial cableway is easy to get to and is an ideal refuge for those wishing to escape the fog. On sunny weekends, we recommend making a reservation and having a look at the timetable.

More information [https://www.praettigau.info/de/ausflugsziele/seilbahn-fanas]

data.name: BirdLife-Naturzentrum Neeracherried
data.abstract: In Neeracherried you can experience nature up close – thanks to a footbridge leading to a reedy marsh and observation huts, two nature trails and an interactive exhibition. Wonderful adventures for all age groups are guaranteed!
data.description: In the vicinity of Zürich and its airport there is an unusual natural oasis: Neeracherried. It is the breeding ground of rare birds such as the Lapwing, and the resting place of migrating birds like the blue Kingfisher with its iridescent feathers. Thanks to observation huts within the nature reserve one can observe these birds without disturbing them. The Nature Center also offers two nature trails, wonderful exhibitions for young and old as well as a variety of guided tours.

data.name: Monte Rosa Hut
data.abstract: This innovative building is reminiscent of a mountain crystal, thanks to its special shape and silvery aluminum shell. But not only is the form innovative – completely novel paths were taken in technical building services and energy management, too.
data.description: Thanks to a photovoltaic system that has been built into the southern façade and thanks to thermal solar collectors, the hut is self-sufficient for over 90 percent of its energy needs. Meltwater is collected and stored in a rock cavern. Furthermore, a micro filtering system bacteriologically cleans the wastewater and the gray-water is re-used for flushing the toilets. The interplay of the individual components as well as an elaborate and cleverly devised energy system are necessary so that the hut can achieve such a high level of energy independence. Software developed by the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH Zürich) controls the technology of the building.

data.name: Küsnachter Tobel
data.abstract: In the Küsnachter Tobel you will find erratic boulders as well as rare animal and plant species.
data.description:
From the Küsnacht pier the tour takes you past the Höchhuus, a residential tower from the 14th century, towards Tobel. Other historic buildings on this route are the former Johanniter Order (now a cantonal school) and the reformed church of St. George. Near the Obere Mühle (Upper Mill), which today houses the local history museum, the hiking tour starts at the brook and proceeds to the Küsnachter Tobel and farther on in the direction of Pfannenstil.

Starting point: 
Schiffsteg (Pier) Küsnacht 
Destination: 
Forch Railway StationDistance:approx. 7 kmDuration:approx. 1 1/2 bis 2 StundenDifficulty: easy to medium

data.name: Milieu & Design – discover District 4
data.abstract: A guided tour through the area around the Langstrasse.
data.description: The Langstrasse area in District 4 with its young but extremely turbulent past has aspects that are nowhere to be found anywhere else in Switzerland. The district is a clear example of authenticity and multicultural diversity and exudes a cosmopolitan outlook. Experience all the contrasts in this vibrant district around the so-called "Chreis Cheib".

data.name: Forest adventure trail
data.abstract: Walk barefoot over pine cones and beech leaves, tune in to your own note with your head in a huge humming stone, or track down insects by following feeding traces in deadwood.
data.description:
This 2-hour, 2-km circular tour offers fantastic ways to experience the forest – from your ears to your toes! Twelve experience stations plunge you into the wilderness of the natural forest: count growth rings on trees; cross glistening moorland water on a wooden gangway, past weird rootstocks and fallen tree trunks; or take your shoes and socks off for a barefoot experience of different surfaces. Will you dare try it with your eyes closed? 

The tour starts and ends at the Sihlwald Visitor Centre.

data.name: Photo Spot Einsiedeln Abbey
data.abstract: The abbey of Saint Meinrad in Einsiedeln has attracted pilgrims for over 1,000 years. It was rebuilt over the centuries and, today, the 18th century baroque-style monastery forms the impressive centre of Einsiedeln. Besides the ‘Chapel of Mercy’ with its famous ‘Black Madonna’, the complex includes a high school, winery and stables for horse breeding. Attracted by the beautiful scenery and a variety of concerts, many nature and culture lovers enjoy visiting Einsiedeln.

data.name: Einsiedeln cross-country skiing arena
data.abstract: Located at the heart of central Switzerland, the pre-Alps high valley of Einsiedeln is shaped by moorland. And on the cross-country trails around Einsiedeln you experience the purest form of enjoyment.
data.description:
The “Schwedentritt“ has a total six routes in Einsiedeln, Gross and Alpthal. The shorter, between 2 to 12 km long stretches, are ideal for a leisurely hike on skis. And for more challenging activity, 16 to 22 km long cross-country trails are available to you. 

The mostly flat 10 km long “Trachslau“ trail leads past the beautiful Au convent over meadows and fields. And for those who prefer more hilly terrain, the 11 km Bolzberg trail is sure to be their choice. This trail also comprises a 4 km long night trail. 
Altitude: 350 meters above sea level 
Classic trail: 25km 
Skating: 25km 
Night trail:4.2km 
Dog trail: none

data.name: Botanic Garden of Grüningen
data.description: Garden master Martin Salm knows every nook and cranny in the Botanic Garden in Grüningen. He introduces the visitors to the secrets of botany and takes them to the new display building. The subject of the tour changes every month: prickling-burning-stinging, vanilla or the myth of plants.

data.name: “Prem Patra” – the love letter
data.description: This tour goes back to the beginnings of Bollywood in Switzerland. The guests visit the locations where the classics were filmed between 1964 and 1970, e.g. “An Evening in Paris”or “Prem Pujara”. In Interlaken, in the Aare Gorge and at Hotel Grimsel Hospiz the guests reawaken the splendid moments on screen.

data.name: Schwarzenbach Kolonialwaren
data.description: This specialty store has been trading in the Niederdorf district for nearly 100 years. Come and admire the huge variety of tea, coffee, dried fruits and pasta, all of which you may buy by weight. Next door you can enjoy a refreshing cuppa at the tea/coffee shop of the same name.

data.name: Fabric Frontline
data.description: Fabric Frontline's silk creations set new standards in the world of fashion. Their softly shimmering silk-satins and special patterns attract customers from all over the world.

data.name: Kulturama
data.abstract: The Kulturama is «The Interdisciplinary Educational Museum». It documents and explains 600 million years of animal and human evolution, human biology and aspects of mankind’s cultural history.
data.description: The museum combines science with cultural history and offers its visitors two exciting journeys through time. In the museum hall, the first journey takes you through 600 million years of evolution to the earliest civilizations. Experience the exciting evolution of life – starting with the first animals, and including the dinosaurs and prehistoric man, and right up to the present day. The second journey takes you through human life from conception to death. You will be amazed and informed as you enjoy the many unusual exhibits on display.

data.name: A trip for those in the know
data.description: Many Indian movies were made in the Lake Geneva region. The Bollywood tour starts in Interlaken and continues to three historic castles and to Lake Geneva and the UNESCO world heritage site of Lavaux. The guides know many of the details about the films made with Indian movie stars in this area.

data.name: Confiserie Sprüngli
data.description:
Confiserie Sprüngli, the traditional Swiss café. This is where the world-famous Luxemburgerli are made. In addition, there are fine pralines or salty treats.

A coffee stop is part of a visit to Switzerland.

data.name: The King of Romance
data.description: Yash Chopra is a famous Bollywood director and the founder of Yash Raj Films. The films of the King of Romance made others aware of Switzerland. The guests visit original locations of blockbusters, e.g. “Darr”, “DDLJ” and “Chandni”. The tour includes a ride on the Yash Chopra Engine of the Jungfrau railways.

data.name: Gastro tour - the classic
data.abstract: Take a tour with two experts who know the local gastro scene intimately, and enjoy each course on the menu in a different restaurant.
data.description: This exciting tour combines a guided walk around the city, a five-course meal and an entertaining evening programme.Over the course of 5 hours, you will visit at least 4 restaurants, covering a distance of 3 kilometres. At each stop-off point on your journey, you will be able to enjoy one course of the menu and hear entertaining anecdotes about Lucerne’s gastronomy.One of the two professional local guides will accompany you throughout the evening and reveal the city from a different perspective. An exciting and unforgettable experience that will leave you with delicious memories.

data.name: Discover the umamiverse
data.description: Young and fresh: Denis, Robin and Manu founded their start-up business, Umami, around four years ago. They produce micro greens for catering and private kitchens. The founders show visitors around the key areas of their business. The ecosystem in Altstetten is home to a wonderful collection of plant and animal species in an aquaponic nutrient cycle in which everything is edible. The fascinating biological microcosm is modelled on nature. On a tour of the production facility, visitors experience the entire process from sowing to harvesting. Finally, you can test your taste buds in a “taste game” and try the house products. You’ll encounter things that taste sweet, sour, bitter, salty - or umami.

data.name: Masterclass in Swiss cheese
data.description:
In her cosy kitchen, the qualified cheese sommelier Sherly will teach you all about the different types of Swiss cheese: not only how they are made, but also the best way to cut, serve and sample the cheeses, as well as the perfect wine pairings. In this masterclass, the group will also bake its very own Swiss cheesecake “Chäschüechli” from scratch.

data.description: The visitors travel to the original locations where Bollywood films were shot in Interlaken and around Lake Thun and Lake Brienz. The guests from India are visiting the castles of Schadau and Spiez and the city of Thun where they can take pictures just like those in the movies.

data.name: Engadine Star
data.abstract: Enjoy the wonderful panorama from the comfort of your seat on this two-hour-train ride.
data.description:
Route: 
Landquart - Klosters - Zernez - St. Moritz

Start off in Landquart, climb the steep ascent to Klosters, pass through the Vereina tunnel, the world's longest meter-gauge tunnel, to Zernez and St. Moritz. Up here, activities are manifold: hike in the Swiss National Park, where you can view pristine flora and fauna up close, take a stroll around Lake St. Moritz, through the Staz Forest or climb up to the local mountain Corviglia or visit the local Segantini Museum, dedicated to the artist whose paintings capture the area so well. 

St. Moritz offers plenty to do and the Engadine Star gives you six hours of time in case you want to take the train back the same day.

From Zernez, you can alternatively take a Postbus over the Ofen Pass to the Val Müstair (Engadine-Meran Route Express) and on to Mals (Italy). Here, take the new Vinschgauer railway to Mediterranean Meran (www.sad.it; Swiss Travel System tickets are not valid).

data.name: Storia & Palazzi.
data.abstract: The picturesque villages of the Engadin are known for their palatial houses built by old local families and elegant sanatoria now converted to fine hotels: both comprise this tour’s “Living Palaces”, alongside world-class historical sights. Routes on the Swiss Map

Discreet service and traditional elegance are hallmarks of this hotel with its 159 rooms including 38 suites. This exquisite luxury is only exceeded by the spectacular panorama of the Engadin mountains. It has long been regarded as a symbol of St. Moritz.

[http://img.myswitzerland.com/457663/325]

HOTEL LA MARGNA, ST. MORITZ [HTTP://WWW.MYSWITZERLAND.COM/EN/27519/HISTORISCHE-HOTELS-LISTE/HOTEL-LA-MARGNA-STMORITZ.HTML]
Nicolaus Hartmann's architecture combines Belle Époque with Engadin home décor to create a relaxing experience of Grand Hotel hospitality - wide lake and mountain views, fragrant pinewood rooms, modern interpretations of classical cuisine and traditional Alpine dining.

CHASA DE CAPOL, SANTA MARIA VAL MÜSTAIR [HTTP://WWW.MYSWITZERLAND.COM/EN/HOME/UNTERKUNFT/HOTEL/THEMENHOTELS/HISTORISCHE-HOTELS-LISTE/54440.HTML]
Kings and princes have come and gone - and now this is a home away from home for those who love something special. Gourmets from all over the world delight in treats from the “castle kitchen” and the 1,000 year old wine cellar where fine South Tyrolean wines are aged in wooden barrels. Attractions in the area.

[http://img.myswitzerland.com/539107/325]

HOTEL MÜNSTERHOF, MÜSTAIR [HTTP://WWW.MYSWITZERLAND.COM/EN/TRANSPORT-TRAVEL/ACCOMMODATIONS/LODGING/AFFORDABLE-HOTELS/80-CHF-PER-PERSON-IN-DOUBLE-ROOM/HOTEL-MUENSTERHOF-1.HTML]
In Müstair village, just a few paces from the UNESCO World Heritage Site of St. John’s Convent, the Münsterhof radiates a historic charm all its own. Built in 1887, the hotel was carefully renovated in period style in 2011; antique furniture adds to the warm, welcoming atmosphere at this traditional family-run venue.

HOTEL WALDHAUS, SILS-MARIA [HTTP://WWW.MYSWITZERLAND.COM/EN/UNTERKUNFT/THEMENHOTELS/HISTORISCHE-HOTELS-LISTE/HISTORISCHE-HOTELS-UND-RESTAURANTS-ICOMOS/HOTEL-WALDHAUS-SILS-MARIA.HTML]
Uncomplicated comfort lies in wait behind the imposing facades of this historical turn-of-the-century building. The hotel was designed by the St. Moritz architect Karl Koller and was built in an outstanding location high above Sils-Maria. It is still run by the founding family. Attractions in the area.

PALAZZO SALIS, SOGLIO [HTTP://WWW.MYSWITZERLAND.COM/EN/UNTERKUNFT/THEMENHOTELS/HISTORISCHE-HOTELS-LISTE/HISTORISCHE-HOTELS-UND-RESTAURANTS-ICOMOS/PALAZZO-SALIS.HTML]
Built in 1630 and expanded in 1701, this villa has served for over a century as a hotel and has remained in family ownership during this period. The past four centuries have left their mark on the furnishings and gentle renovations have ensured that the hotel has a very special atmosphere.
